Header.Name: MDrecord_corpus
Header.Description: Profile for corpora for CLARIN-SHARE v1.0.1; intended ONLY for conversion from the original schema to CMDI

CMD_Element.name: metadataCreationDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date of creation of this metadata description (automatically inserted by the MetaShare software)

CMD_Element.name: metadataLastDateUpdated
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date of the last updating of the metadata record (automatically inserted by the MetaShare software)

CMD_Element.name: compliesWith
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the vocabulary/standard/best practice to which a resource is compliant with

CMD_Element.name: revision
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides an account of the revisions in free text or a link to a document with revisions

CMD_Element.name: MetadataRecordIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: A string (e.g., PID, DOI, internal to an organization, etc.) used to uniquely identify a metadata record

CMD_Element.name: resourceName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The full name by which the resource is known; the element can be repeated for the different language versions using the "lang" attribute to specify the language.

CMD_Element.name: resourceShortName
CMD_Element.Documentation: Introduces a short form (e.g., abbreviation, acronym, etc.) used to refer to a language resource

CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides the description of the resource in prose

CMD_Element.Documentation: A string (e.g., PID, DOI, internal to an organization, etc.) used to uniquely identify a language resource

item.AppInfo: Archival Resource Key
Identifier for ArXiv (http://arxiv.org/), a open access repository of preprints, having the format arXiv:1207.2147
It is the Astrophysics Data System bibliographic codes, a standardized 19 character identifier according to the syntax yyyyjjjjjvvvvmppppa

Value for LRTIdentifierScheme referring to the identifier assigned by META-SHARE (http://www.meta-share.org/)

CMD_Element.name: logo
CMD_Element.Documentation: Links to a symbol or graphic object used to identify an entity; please, add a URL with an image file

CMD_Element.name: version
CMD_Element.Documentation: Associates a language resource with a pattern that indicates its version; the recommended way is to follow the semantic versioning guidelines (http://semver.org) and use a numeric pattern of the form major_version.minor_version.patch

CMD_Element.name: versionDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: Identifies the date associated with the version of the language resource being described (as a recommendation, of the latest update of the particular version)

CMD_Element.name: updateFrequency
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the frequency with which the resource is updated

CMD_Element.name: revision
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides an account of the revisions in free text or a link to a document with revisions

CMD_Element.name: citationText
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides the text that must be quoted for citation purposes when using a language resource

CMD_Element.name: publicationDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the date when a language resource has been made available to the public

CMD_Element.name: creationStartDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date in which the creation process was started

CMD_Element.Documentation: The date in which the creation process was completed

CMD_Element.name: creationMode
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies whether the resource was created automatically or in a manual or interactive mode

item.AppInfo: Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for fully automatic processes where the results of the process have undergone no manual edits
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for processes that include some interaction between the processing tool and the human agent performing the process
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for processes that are performed manually
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for mixed processes, usually involving an automatic processing followed by human edits

CMD_Element.name: lrType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the type of the resource being described or the type of the resource that a tool or service takes as input or produces as output

item.AppInfo: for text, speech, video, multimodal/multimedia corpora, corpora with sensorimotor information, n-gram resources

CMD_Element.name: corpusSubclass
CMD_Element.Documentation: Introduces a classification of corpora into types (used for descriptive reasons)

CMD_Element.name: userQuery
CMD_Element.Documentation: Introduces a query performed by a user that has resulted in the creation of the resource being described (e.g. a dataset created with a query aggregating texts from a database, or subset of a lexical resource, or a virtual collection of sentences from online corpora)

CMD_Element.name: mediaType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the media type of a language resource (the physical medium of the contents representation) or of the input/output of a language processing tool/service; each media type is described through a distinctive set of technical features; a language resource may consist of different media parts

item.AppInfo: only written medium

CMD_Element.name: modalityType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the type of the modality represented in the resource or processed by a tool/service

item.AppInfo: Value for 'ModalityType' for body gestures represented in a language resource
Value for 'ModalityType' for language resources that include various modalities
Value for 'ModalityType' for facial expressions represented in a language resource
Value used when none of the recommended values of an element is appropriate for an item
Value for 'ModalityType' for sign languages represented in a language resource
Value for 'ModalityType' for language resources including spoken language words and expressions
Value used for mandatory elements whose value is unknown or cannot be specified
Value for 'ModalityType' for voice
Value for 'ModalityType' for texts with written language

CMD_Element.name: lingualityType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates whether the resource includes one, two or more languages

item.AppInfo: Value for 'Linguality type' for resource (parts) which include material in two languages
Value for 'Linguality type' for resource (parts) which include material in one language
Value for 'Linguality type' for resource (parts) which include material in three or more languages

CMD_Element.name: multilingualityType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates whether the resource (part) is parallel, comparable or mixed

item.AppInfo: Value for 'Multilinguality type' for resource parts or resources that consist of the similar text segments in two or more languages (e.g., a corpus of legislation texts in Greek and English)

Value for 'Multilinguality type' for resource parts or resources that consist of segments including text in two or more languages (e.g., the transcription of a European Parliament session with MPs speaking in their native language)
Value used when none of the recommended values of an element is appropriate for an item
Value for 'Multilinguality type' for resource parts or resources that consist of the equivalent text segments in two or more languages (e.g., an original and its translation equivalents)
Value used for mandatory elements whose value is unknown or cannot be specified

CMD_Element.name: multilingualityTypeDetails
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides further information on multilinguality of a resource in free text

CMD_Element.name: languageTag
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the language that is included in the resource or supported by the component, according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines

CMD_Element.name: languageId
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the language subelement according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines (i.e. ISO 639-3 codes when existing supplemented with ISO 639-3 codes for new entries)

CMD_Element.name: scriptId
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the script subelement according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines (i.e. ISO 15924 codes)<

CMD_Element.name: regionId
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the region subelement according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines (i.e. ISO 3166 codes)

CMD_Element.name: variantId
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the variant subelement according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines

CMD_Element.name: languageVarietyName
CMD_Element.Documentation: A textual string used for referring to a language variety

CMD_Element.name: categoryLabel
CMD_Element.Documentation: Introduces a human readable name (label) by which a classification category (e.g. text type, text genre, domain, etc.) is known

CMD_Element.Documentation: A string used to uniquely identify a text type according to a specific classification scheme

CMD_Element.name: mediaType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the media type of the resource and basically corresponds to the physical medium of the content representation. Each media type is described through a distinctive set of features. A resource may consist of parts attributed to different types of media. A tool/service may take as input/output more than one different media types.

item.AppInfo: for a whole resource or part of a resource that is recorded as an audio file

CMD_Element.name: modalityType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the type of the modality represented in the resource or processed by a tool/service

CMD_Element.name: lingualityType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates whether the resource includes one, two or more languages

item.AppInfo: Value for 'Linguality type' for resource (parts) which include material in two languages
Value for 'Linguality type' for resource (parts) which include material in one language
Value for 'Linguality type' for resource (parts) which include material in three or more languages

CMD_Element.name: multilingualityType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates whether the resource (part) is parallel, comparable or mixed

item.AppInfo: Value for 'Multilinguality type' for resource parts or resources that consist of the similar text segments in two or more languages (e.g., a corpus of legislation texts in Greek and English)

Value for 'Multilinguality type' for resource parts or resources that consist of segments including text in two or more languages (e.g., the transcription of a European Parliament session with MPs speaking in their native language)
Value used when none of the recommended values of an element is appropriate for an item
Value for 'Multilinguality type' for resource parts or resources that consist of the equivalent text segments in two or more languages (e.g., an original and its translation equivalents)
Value used for mandatory elements whose value is unknown or cannot be specified

CMD_Element.name: multilingualityTypeDetails
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides further information on multilinguality of a resource in free text

CMD_Element.name: languageTag
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the language that is included in the resource or supported by the component, according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines

CMD_Element.name: languageId
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the language subelement according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines (i.e. ISO 639-3 codes when existing supplemented with ISO 639-3 codes for new entries)

CMD_Element.name: scriptId
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the script subelement according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines (i.e. ISO 15924 codes)<

CMD_Element.name: regionId
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the region subelement according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines (i.e. ISO 3166 codes)

CMD_Element.name: variantId
CMD_Element.Documentation: The identifier of the variant subelement according to the IETF BCP47 guidelines

CMD_Element.name: languageVarietyName
CMD_Element.Documentation: A textual string used for referring to a language variety

CMD_Element.name: categoryLabel
CMD_Element.Documentation: Introduces a human readable name (label) by which a classification category (e.g. text type, text genre, domain, etc.) is known

CMD_Element.name: VideoGenreIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: A string used to uniquely identify a video genre according to a specific classification scheme

CMD_Element.name: annotationType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the annotation type of the annotated version(s) of a resource or the annotation type a tool/ service requires or produces as an output

CMD_Element.name: annotatedElement
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the elements annotated at each annotation level

item.AppInfo: background noise
discourse marker
Value used when none of the recommended values of an element is appropriate for an item
speaker noise
Value used for mandatory elements whose value is unknown or cannot be specified

CMD_Element.name: segmentationLevel
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the segmentation unit in terms of which the resource has been segmented or the level of segmentation a tool/service requires/outputs

item.AppInfo: Value used when none of the recommended values of an element is appropriate for an item
prosodic boundary
Value used for mandatory elements whose value is unknown or cannot be specified
word group

CMD_Element.name: annotationStandoff
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates whether the annotation is created inline or in a stand-off fashion

CMD_Element.name: theoreticModel
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates the theoretic model applied for the creation/enrichment of the resource, by name and/or by reference (URL or bibliographic reference) to informative material about the theoretic model used

CMD_Element.name: annotationMode
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates whether the resource is annotated manually or by automatic processes

item.AppInfo: Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for fully automatic processes where the results of the process have undergone no manual edits
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for processes that include some interaction between the processing tool and the human agent performing the process
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for processes that are performed manually
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for mixed processes, usually involving an automatic processing followed by human edits

CMD_Element.name: annotationModeDetails
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides further information on annotation process

CMD_Element.name: annotationStartDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date in which the annotation process has started

CMD_Element.name: annotationEndDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date in which the annotation process has ended

CMD_Element.name: interannotatorAgreement
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides information on the interannotator agreement and the methods/metrics applied

CMD_Element.name: intraannotatorAgreement
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides information on the intra-annotator agreement and the methods/metrics applied

CMD_Element.name: title
CMD_Element.Documentation: Introduces a human-readable text (typically short) used as a name for referring to the document being described

CMD_Element.name: DocumentIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: A string (e.g., PID, DOI, internal to an organization, etc.) used to uniquely identify a document (mainly intended for published documents)

CD-ROM refers to a kind of distribution medium used for delivering a language resource; intended for resources delivered on CD-ROM

Value for data distribution medium, used for language resources delivered on a DVD-R

CMD_Element.name: downloadLocation

CMD_Element.name: accessLocation

CMD_Element.name: privateResource

CMD_Element.name: samplesLocation

CMD_Element.name: attributionText

CMD_Element.name: availabilityStartDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the start date of availability of a resource - only for cases where a resource is available for a restricted time period

CMD_Element.name: availabilityEndDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the end date of availability of a resource - only for cases where a resource is available for a restricted time period

CMD_Element.name: sizeHeight

CMD_Element.name: licenceTermsName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The name by which a legal document (e.g., licence, terms of use, terms of service) is known

CMD_Element.name: licenceTermsURL
CMD_Element.Documentation: Links to the URL where the text of a licence/terms of use/service is found

CMD_Element.name: conditionOfUse
CMD_Element.Documentation: Links a licence with a specific condition/term of use imposed for accessing a language resource. It is an optional element and only to be taken as providing brief human readable information on the fact that the language resource is provided under a specific set of conditions. These correspond to the most frequently used conditions imposed by the licensor (via the specified licence). The proper exposition of all conditions and possible exceptions is to be found inside the licence text. Depositors should, hence, carefully choose the values of this field to match the licence chosen and users should carefully read that licence before using the language resource.

CMD_Element.name: licenceCategory
CMD_Element.Documentation: Categorises a licence according to a classification scheme

Value for licence category; for licences for resources that can be access only by logged in users

CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies whether the language resource contains sensitive data (e.g., medical/health-related, etc.) and thus requires special handling

CMD_Element.name: anonymizationDetails
